results.title: Rodin's inferno = L'enfer de Rodin (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Art film on the works of the great French sculptor Rodin. The film, which has no commentary, attempts to illustrate the meeting of two dreams, that of Dante and that of Rodin. Two titles are used, one at the opening of the film, “Life … that miracle (Rodin)” and another before the Descent into Hell “Abandon hope all ye who enter here … (Dante)”. Using lighting effects and camera movement, the film brings to life the world of Rodin’s statues, working from the two principal sources of the sculptor’s inspiration, Love and Pain. His works are grouped according to the following themes:-The Creation of Man and Woman; Love and the Human Passion; Old Age; Poverty and Decay; the Descent into Hell, and the Vision of Hell

results.title: Rodeo Road

results.title: Rodeo cowboy
results.brief_description: Takes an intimate look at the men who make their living riding in rodeos, their dreams, their disappointments and their physical injuries. Being a rodeo cowboy is an adventurous and challenging life and although only a few ever make any real money, most would not trade for anything else. The camaraderie and dependence of friend upon friend and man upon animal are the motivations that hold them together. Photographed by Rick Freidberg and Mort “Kai” Schuman. Features soundtrack of original songs by Tim McIntire.

results.title: Rocky horror and disco
results.brief_description: Choose from 20 songs selected from “The Rocky horror picture show” as well as disco hits set to an incongruous nature background. All lyrics appear on screen and the soundtrack is instrumental only. Please note: The disc plays PAL one side, NTSC the other.

results.title: Rocky
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Irwin Winkler, Robert Chartoff and John G. Avildsen
results.brief_description: Rocky Balboa (Sylvester Stallone), otherwise known as the “Italian Stallion” is an underdog challenged to fight the reigning heavyweight champion, Apollo Creed (Carl Weathers). Unperturbed and inspired by his dedicated manger Mickey (Burgess Meredith) and girlfriend Adrian (Talia Shire), Rocky has his eyes on the prize and a motivation to win. It is his one chance at fortune, self-respect, love and the world heavyweight crown. Filmed in only twenty eight days and with a screenplay written by Sylvester Stallone, “Rocky” won three Academy Awards including Best Picture.

results.title: Rocks and minerals: how do we identify them?
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Tom Ascher
results.brief_description: Noticing the pattern, composition and texture of rocks we find that we can identify them, and gain clues how they are formed. Minerals are identified by tests which can lead to an understanding of processes occurring within the earth.

results.title: Rocks and minerals. - Rev. ed.
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Understanding Our Earth”.
Provides clear description of how the various types of igneous, sedimentary and metamorphic rocks are formed. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
